Today is: Friday, August 15, 2025

If a 3-D xianxia cour-length anime were budgeted at 100 million RMB per episodeâ€”every yuan spent only on the anime itself, with marketing and labor overhead on topâ€”its production values would land squarely in the top-tier global CG feature zone. Think ILM/Disney+ series texture: 4-8K native rendering, full path-traced lighting, sub-surface skin, micro-thread cloth, bespoke muscle rigs, fluid sims for every spell, and bespoke Houdini FX passes that run for weeks per shot. Each 24-minute episode would command roughly 14â€“16 million USD, matching or beating the per-minute spend of â€œAvatar: The Last Airbenderâ€ live-action or â€œStar Wars: Visionsâ€ shorts. Assets would be built once at film fidelity, then reused across the cour, letting the team pour money into shot-specific polish instead of just building models.

Character count would stay tightâ€”maybe 12 hero rigs, 30 mid-tier, 200 backgroundâ€”but every hero asset would get a 400-bone face rig, FACS blend-shapes, and a proprietary hair groom that can survive close-ups in 8K. Cloth is full Marvelous-to-Houdini pipeline; capes and silks sim on top of muscle caches, then run through a second QC pass in Katana. Environments are megascans mixed with hand-sculpted displacement: one establishing cliff city can eat 6 TB of texture tiles, but because the budget allows a 500-person floor across four studios (Chengdu, Suzhou, Vancouver, L.A.), the disk cost is trivial. Comp shots average 120 layers; every spell gets its own Nuke script, and the final grade is a 64-bit HDR Dolby Vision pass.

On the audio side, youâ€™re recording a 96-piece Chinese orchestra at Avatar Studios in New York, plus a 40-member throat-singing choir from Inner Mongolia. Foley is captured on a Zhangjiajie stone ridge for natural reverb, then sweetened at Skywalker Ranch. Dubbing cycles three takes per line minimum; ADR is done on 192-kHz mics so the down-sampled 48 kHz keeps ultrasonic air. Mix is Atmos 7.1.4, delivered in both theatrical and streaming stems.

Scheduling: 22 months pre-pro, 14 months shot production, 4 months final grade and sound. Thatâ€™s possible because the 100 million per episode buys parallel pipelines; episode 1 is in final comp while episode 9 is still in layout. Director has final say on every shot, and the budget covers a â€œno-questions-askedâ€ retake fund equal to 8 % of the episode costâ€”about 8 million RMBâ€”so anything that doesnâ€™t screen-perfect is simply re-done.

Place this against current Chinese titles: â€œNe Zhaâ€ (2019) cost ~60 million RMB for 110 minutes; you are spending 1.3 times that for each 24-minute block. â€œWhite Snakeâ€ (2019) came in at ~80 million RMB for 99 minutes; your per-minute burn is 5Ã— higher. Even the flashiest Tencent seasonals (â€œDouluo Dalu,â€ â€œQin Shi Mingyueâ€) top out around 2â€“3 million RMB per episode; you outspend them by 30â€“50Ã—. The only remotely comparable spend in Asia is Studio Ghibliâ€™s â€œEarwig and the Witchâ€ TV budget, but that was still sub-4 million USD per half-hourâ€”and TV anime pipelines, not feature CG.

Bottom line: visual fidelity would sit between â€œAvatar 2â€ and a Pixar feature, but delivered every week for three months. In todayâ€™s domestic landscape it would be an unambiguous #1, not even close. The gap in texture resolution, simulation depth, and audio production would make every other Chinese 3-D series look like pre-vis.

**English Materials on "Home" for Binder**

**Meaning of Home**  
Home is more than four walls; it is the safest place to recharge, a private harbor where identity is confirmed and memories are stored.

**Ways Dreams Make a Home Warmer**  
1. Dream together: a shared vision (e.g., travel, garden, childâ€™s future) turns routine into collaboration.  
2. Dream dÃ©cor: imagining colors, lights, or scents before buying makes every object carry a story.  
3. Dream rituals: bedtime stories, Sunday breakfasts, or birthday codes invented in dreams become traditions that outlast objects.

**Reasons**  
- Emotional glue: shared dreams bond members more tightly than any mortgage.  
- Hope reservoir: on hard days the imagined future acts like central heating for the spirit.  
- Identity printer: when dreams are displayed (photos, sketches, verses on the fridge), the home announces â€œthis is us,â€ not just â€œthis is ours.â€

Here is a compact one-page hand-out you can slip into any English binder.  
It keeps your original three-part structure, but the language is tightened, the verbs are more vivid, and every sentence is short enough to double as a quotation for essays or classroom walls.

--------------------------------------------------------
HOME: the shortest love-story we ever tell
--------------------------------------------------------

1.  What â€œhomeâ€ really means  
Home is not square footage; it is the only place on earth where the door closes and the world says, â€œIâ€™ll wait outside.â€  
Here identity is spoken back to us in our own coffee mugs, light switches, and the crack in the ceiling we know by heart.

2.  Three ways dreams turn a home into a heater  
Dream together  
   â€“ Map the same future: a vegetable patch, a train ride across Russia, a daughter who will one day outgrow her shoes.  
   â€“ Shared blueprints make even dish-washing feel like co-authoring.  

Dream dÃ©cor  
   â€“ Before you spend a dollar, spend an hour imagining the lamp at 7 p.m. in February.  
   â€“ Objects purchased after a rehearsal of light and scent arrive pre-loaded with memory.  

Dream rituals  
   â€“ Invent a password for birthdays, a song for Mondays, a two-second dance for when the elevator is late.  
   â€“ Repeat until the ritual owns you; traditions outlive furniture and sometimes people.

3.  Why it works  
Emotional glue  
   Joint visions stick better than any mortgage rate.  

Hope reservoir  
   On the coldest day of the year the future you pictured is a thermostat set to â€œtomorrow.â€  

Identity printer  
   Photos, sketches, and crooked verses on the fridge broadcast the same headline:  
   â€œThis is US,â€ not merely â€œthis is ours.â€

--------------------------------------------------------
One-sentence takeaway  
Dream out loud within your four walls, and the walls will dream back.

sentence-transformersä¸transformersåº“åŒºåˆ«

### Step-by-step analysis:

#### 1. Clarify the positioning of the two libraries
- **transformers**: a **general-purpose pre-trained model library** developed by Hugging Face, supporting **all kinds of NLP tasks** (classification, generation, QA, etc.) such as BERT, GPT, T5.
- **sentence-transformers** (SBERT) is an **extension library built on transformers**, **specialized in sentence-level embeddings**, optimized for semantic similarity, text retrieval, etc.


#### 2. Core differences

| **Dimension**         | **transformers**                          | **sentence-transformers**                     |
|-----------------------|------------------------------------------|----------------------------------------------|
| **Design goal**       | General NLP tasks (multi-task support)   | Specialized in sentence semantic embeddings (single-objective optimization) |
| **Model architecture**| Native pre-trained models (e.g., BERT, RoBERTa) | Adds **pooling layer + fine-tuning strategy** (e.g., Siamese network) on top of transformers |
| **Output type**       | Token-level hidden states (manual pooling needed) or task-specific heads | **Direct fixed-size sentence vectors** (e.g., 384/768-d) |
| **Usage complexity**  | Manual pooling, normalization (e.g., `[CLS]` vector) | **One-line sentence embedding** (`model.encode()`) |
| **Training method**   | Pre-train + task-specific fine-tune (needs labeled data) | **Contrastive learning** (Triplet Loss, MNR Loss) with **sentence pairs** |
| **Typical tasks**     | Classification, generation, QA, etc.     | Semantic search, clustering, duplicate detection |
| **Pre-trained models**| `bert-base-uncased`, `gpt2`, etc.        | `all-MiniLM-L6-v2`, `paraphrase-multilingual-mpnet-base-v2`, etc. (optimized for sentence embeddings) |
| **Compute efficiency**| Task-dependent (slow for long generation) | Optimized for sentence inference, **faster than raw transformers** (ONNX support) |


#### 3. Key concepts
- **Sentence embedding**: maps whole text into a **fixed-length vector** so semantically similar sentences are close in vector space (cosine similarity > 0.9).
- **Contrastive learning**: trains the model to distinguish semantic differences by constructing **positive (similar) and negative (dissimilar) sentence pairs**, yielding a more uniform embedding space.


#### 4. Code comparison
**transformers manual pooling**:
```python
from transformers import AutoTokenizer, AutoModel
import torch

tokenizer = AutoTokenizer.from_pretrained("bert-base-uncased")
model = AutoModel.from_pretrained("bert-base-uncased")

sentences = ["I love apples", "I adore apples"]
inputs = tokenizer(sentences, padding=True, return_tensors="pt")

with torch.no_grad():
    outputs = model(**inputs)
    embeddings = outputs.last_hidden_state.mean(dim=1)  # [2, 768]
```

**sentence-transformers one-liner**:
```python
from sentence_transformers import SentenceTransformer

model = SentenceTransformer("all-MiniLM-L6-v2")
embeddings = model.encode(["I love apples", "I adore apples"])  # [2, 384]
```


#### 5. Summary
transformers is the **general base**, while sentence-transformers is the **specialized tool**â€”through **architecture tweaks** and **contrastive learning**, it reduces sentence embedding to a single call and outperforms raw transformers by 10â€“20 % on STS benchmarks.
How to roll back code when the generated qoder code is wrongâ€”currently, thereâ€™s no visible way.

In Qoder there is currently no graphical â€œone-click rollbackâ€ button, but underneath itâ€™s just a normal Git repo, so a Git command rolls you back instantly. Below are the 3 most common, safest ways, ordered by â€œblast radiusâ€ from smallest to largestâ€”copy-paste as needed.

------------------------------------------------
1. Roll back a single file to the last commit  
(affects nothing else, lightest)

# in terminal, go to project root
git checkout HEAD -- src/components/HelloWorld.vue
# file is instantly back to the last commit
# refresh in Qoder and youâ€™ll see the code restored

------------------------------------------------
2. Roll the entire working tree back to the last commit  
(undoes every change you made, but **history stays intact**)

git reset --hard HEAD
# working tree + index become clean; caution: uncommitted changes vanish

------------------------------------------------
3. Already committed and realize itâ€™s wrongâ€”erase the â€œlast commitâ€  
(history loses one commit, good for â€œjust pushed and regretted itâ€)

git reset --hard HEAD~1        # roll local back one commit
git push origin HEAD --force   # force-sync to remote (coordinate with team first)

------------------------------------------------
Tips  
- Type the commands in Qoderâ€™s built-in Terminal (bottom panel â†’ Terminal); no need to leave the IDE.  
- Worried about mistakes? `git stash` first, then `git stash pop` to recover later.  
- After rolling back, refresh the file tree (Ctrl/Cmd + R) so Qoderâ€™s editor cache updates.

One-liner: Qoder has no â€œvisual rollbackâ€ button, but itâ€™s just Gitâ€”`git checkout` / `git reset` is fastest.

### 1. SSD vs HDD: A â€œPackage Deliveryâ€ Analogy  
| Scenario | Mechanical HDD | Solid-State SSD |
|---|---|---|
| **Warehouse location** | Big warehouse on the outskirtsâ€”huge capacity, long drive | Small downtown depotâ€”less capacity, next door |
| **How items are fetched** | Courier drives a little cart (read-head) inside, hunts down the shelf (platter), loads up slowly | Courier just reaches out and grabs the parcel (instant electrical lookup), done in a flash |
| **Speed feel** | Boot 30-60 s, Photoshop spins its wheel forever | Boot 5-10 s, Photoshop opens the instant you click |
| **What it fears** | Drops & bumpsâ€”cart can tip and scratch shelves (head crash) | Drop-proof; no carts, all circuits |
| **Price** | 1 TB â‰ˆ Â¥250â€”cheap and roomy | 1 TB â‰ˆ Â¥350-400â€”costlier |
| **Noise** | Constant hum, like a small fan at night | Dead silent |

One-liner:  
HDD = â€œbig warehouse + cart delivery,â€ cheap but slow; SSD = â€œdowntown convenience store,â€ pricier yet lightning-fast and shock-proof.

---

### 2. â€œNot Enough Memoryâ€? First Decide: RAM or Storage?
1. **Symptom check**  
   - Browser/game open, HDD LED frantic, fans roar, stuttersâ€”**RAM shortage**  
   - Installer yells â€œinsufficient disk spaceâ€â€”**drive is full**, add/replace drive

2. **Buying & fitting RAM (DIY)**  
   â‘  Generation:  
   - Laptops: DDR4 (2015-2021 mainstream) or DDR5 (2022+ new rigs)  
   - Desktops: same rule; **laptop and desktop sticks donâ€™t swap**  
   â‘¡ Capacity:  
   - Office + browsing: 8 GB Ã— 2 = 16 GB plenty  
   - Gaming / PS / video edit: 16 GB Ã— 2 = 32 GB sweet  
   â‘¢ Speed:  
   - DDR4: common 2666 / 3200 MHzâ€”pick 3200  
   - DDR5: go 5600 MHz or higher  
   â‘£ Brands & sources: Kingston, Adata, G.Skill, Corsairâ€”JD.com/Tmall flagship stores, almost no fakes  
   â‘¤ Install:  
   - Laptop: 1-2 back screws, insert stick at angle â†’ press till it clicks, 5 min job  
   - Desktop: power off â†’ pop both latches â†’ insert vertically â†’ click, done

3. **Buying & fitting a drive (DIY)**  
   - Old spinner too slow: grab a 2.5" SATA SSD (Samsung 870 EVO, Kioxia TC10), swap straight in  
   - Want even faster: pick M.2 NVMe SSD (Samsung 980, WD SN770), slot into motherboard, one screw, 10 min upgrade

---

### 3. One-Page Cheat Sheet (copy & succeed)
| Goal | What to buy | Example model | Price hint |
|---|---|---|---|
| Laggy PC, multitask freeze | 16 GB (8Ã—2) DDR4-3200 RAM | Kingston Fury 3200 8GÃ—2 | Â¥220 |
| Slow boot / game loading | 1 TB SATA SSD | Samsung 870 EVO 1 TB | Â¥350 |
| Max speed & board has M.2 | 1 TB NVMe SSD | WD SN770 1 TB | Â¥380 |

**Remember the rhyme**:  
â€œStutter? Add RAM. Sluggish? Go SSD. Check slot before you buy, power downâ€”five-minute high.â€
How to check if your computer has an SSD or HDD.

### 3 quickest ways to tell in 30 seconds whether your PC has an SSD or HDDâ€”and how big each one is.

---

#### 1. Built-in Task Manager (Win10/11) â€“ fastest
1. Press `Ctrl + Shift + Esc`  
2. Go to **â€œPerformanceâ€** tab â†’ pick **â€œDisk 0 / Disk 1â€¦â€** on the left  
3. Top-right line shows:  
   - **SSD** = solid-state  
   - **HDD** = mechanical  
   Capacity (GB) is on the same lineâ€”done

---

#### 2. Disk Defragmenter â€“ instant ID
1. Hit `Win`, type **â€œdefragâ€**, press Enter  
2. Window lists every drive:  
   - **â€œSolid-state driveâ€** = SSD  
   - **â€œHard disk driveâ€** = HDD  
   Size, letter, and type all in one view

---

#### 3. Need model details? Grab CrystalDiskInfo (optional)
1. Search **CrystalDiskInfo** â†’ download portable zip (< 5 MB)  
2. Launch:  
   - **Rotation** column shows **â€œâ€”â€** = SSD  
   - Shows **â€œ5400 RPM / 7200 RPMâ€** = HDD  
   Also gives power-on hours, temp, healthâ€”handy for second-hand checks

---

### Quick-reference table
| Where | Says â€œSSDâ€ | Says â€œHDD/7200 RPMâ€ |
| --- | --- | --- |
| Task Manager â†’ Performance â†’ Disk | SSD | HDD |
| Defragment tool | Solid-state drive | Hard disk drive |
| CrystalDiskInfo | Rotation â€œâ€”â€ | Rotation â€œ5400/7200â€ |

---

### Common setups
- **Ultrabook**: single M.2 SSD only  
- **Old laptop**: 128 GB SSD + 1 TB HDD (dual drives)  
- **Desktop**: C: SSD + D: 1 TB HDD; Task Manager lists **Disk 0, Disk 1**

Pick any methodâ€”30 seconds later youâ€™ll know which drive is which and how big.

[Search keywords]: Russian oil painting style, birch grove, beauty

[No.]: [^1^]  
Title: Oil-painted beauties, brimming with tenderness and grace!  
Site: WeChat (Oil Painting Classroom)  
Date: 2025-08-13  
Excerpt 1:  
You can sense the deep love hidden in his heart.  

You can see his masterful interpretation of light and shadow, his complete command of color. Whether figure or landscape, everything is vividly lifelike. The figures in his works are bathed in superb light, giving a sun-drenched, languid warmth; the whole canvas glows with quiet serenity. His rendering of light is magical, his color use highly atmospheric, his brushwork boldly blocky. The women he paints are exquisitely beautifulâ€”soft, graceful, with striking features and eyes that shimmer like rippling water, each one a serene goddess. Subtle color shifts create delicate, rosy skin full of layering. Without minute outlining, the effect is utterly comfortable. He focuses on expression, costume, and accessories, varying styles so every figure offers a fresh visual experience. Each is a stunning beauty, tender and poised, stirring the heart. He paints from part to whole.  

[Search keywords]: Russian painter, birch grove, oil painting, figure  

[No.]: [^2^]  
Title: Masterpiece Appreciation: â€œBirch Groveâ€  
Site: Sohu  
Date: 2017-08-24  
Excerpt 1:  
â€œBirch Groveâ€ â€“ Birch Grove, 1885-1889, 30 Ã— 50 cm, oil on canvas, Isaak Ilyich Levitan (1860-1900), Tretyakov Gallery, Moscow.  

The first impression is one of tranquil, gentle, soft light. The entire grove bathes in warm sunshine, giving an indescribable sense of ease, as if inside a fairy-tale world.  

In 19th-century Russian critical realism, Levitan was a leading landscape painter. After overwork forced him to recuperate in Italy, Switzerland and France, he encountered French Impressionist plein-air methods, influencing his style. In this painting he captures sunlight and air within the birches, showing clear Impressionist traits. Levitanâ€™s mood is delicate, scene and sentiment merge, poetic and full of nationalist feeling. Works like â€œBirch Groveâ€ lyrically display the charm of the birch, letting viewers taste natureâ€™s ecological beauty.  

[Search keywords]: Russian oil painting, birch grove, beauty, traditional technique  

[No.]: [^3^]  
Title: Birch Grove _ Baidu Baike  
Site: Baidu Baike  
Date: 2025-06-06  
Excerpt 1:  
Arkhip Ivanovich Kuindzhi (1842-1910), famed 19th-c. Russian landscape painter, broke through academic conventions with revolutionary explorations of natural light and color. A member of the Peredvizhniki, his singular style is instantly recognizable.  

After the 1880 solo exhibition of â€œMoonlight Night on the Dnieperâ€ brought sensational success, in 1881 he repeated the one-picture show format with â€œBirch Grove,â€ unprecedented in Russian art and revealing supreme confidence in the workâ€™s impact.  

- Horizontal wide composition deepens the groveâ€™s perspective.  
- Strong chiaroscuro models the trunks in light and volume.  
- Cool background hues set off the warm texture of the white bark.  
- Impasto conveys bark tactility and leafy depth.  

Precise light calculation creates three-dimensional sunshine on a two-dimensional plane; trunk highlights echo dappled ground shadows, forming vigorous visual rhythm. Painted by Kuindzhi, 97 cm Ã— 181 cm, now in the Tretyakov Gallery.  

In April 2007, at the China-Russia National Exhibition in Moscow, Jiangsu Hongye Group displayed an embroidery version of the famous Russian oil painting â€œMorning in the Birch Grove.â€ Using 15 color gradations of silk thread, it reproduced the workâ€™s light layers and color transitions, becoming the exhibitionâ€™s most noted applied-art piece.  

[Search keywords]: Russian oil painting, birch grove, beauty, traditional technique  

[No.]: [^4^]  
Title: Author Introduction  
Site: Guangdong Museum of Art  
Date: 2006-08-03  
Excerpt 1:  
In 1887 the noted Kazan professor-physician Viktor Leonidovich Grudzhev bought the painting and the studio hut at a Petersburg auction; in 1919 he donated them to a museum.  

Well aware of Europeâ€™s new art currents, the young Repin began experimenting early. In a sense this portrait foresaw the birth of Russian Impressionism. He tried new techniques, using an unusual composition: the model sits casually, bathed in backlight.  

The painter poetically and passionately shapes a girl intoxicated by reading; air and light envelop her, giving a sense of youth and joy. His brushwork is light and dynamic, softly stroking; a gradual golden halo crowns her fluffy light-yellow hair. Light strikes the book, its reflection illuminating the girlâ€™s face. The paintingâ€™s incompleteness (hand and book unfinished) heightens freshness and adds bright, harmonious mood.  

51. Repin, I. E. (1844-1930)  

â€œBarge Haulers by a Campfireâ€

How many emperors were there in the Qing Dynasty?

To answer â€œhow many emperors did the Qing dynasty have,â€ I first need to fix the dynastyâ€™s start and end dates, then list every reigning monarch. messages.content: Historical tool_call results have been hidden

The Qing Dynasty had a total of **12 emperors**.

The complete list is as follows:

1. **Emperor Taizu of Qing, Aisin Gioro Nurhaci** (Khan of Heavenly Mandate), reigned 1616â€“1626.  
2. **Emperor Taizong of Qing, Aisin Gioro Hong Taiji** (Khan of Abundant Acumen, Emperor of Chongde), reigned 1626â€“1643.  
3. **Emperor Shizu of Qing, Aisin Gioro Fulin** (Emperor Shunzhi), reigned 1643â€“1661.  
4. **Emperor Shengzu of Qing, Aisin Gioro Xuanye** (Emperor Kangxi), reigned 1661â€“1722.  
5. **Emperor Shizong of Qing, Aisin Gioro Yinzhen** (Emperor Yongzheng), reigned 1722â€“1735.  
6. **Emperor Gaozong of Qing, Aisin Gioro Hongli** (Emperor Qianlong), reigned 1735â€“1796.  
7. **Emperor Renzong of Qing, Aisin Gioro Yongyan** (Emperor Jiaqing), reigned 1796â€“1820.  
8. **Emperor Xuanzong of Qing, Aisin Gioro Minning** (Emperor Daoguang), reigned 1820â€“1850.  
9. **Emperor Wenzong of Qing, Aisin Gioro Yizhu** (Emperor Xianfeng), reigned 1850â€“1861.  
10. **Emperor Muzong of Qing, Aisin Gioro Zaichun** (Emperor Tongzhi), reigned 1861â€“1874.  
11. **Emperor Dezong of Qing, Aisin Gioro Zaitian** (Emperor Guangxu), reigned 1875â€“1908.  
12. **Emperor Puyi of Qing, Aisin Gioro Puyi** (Emperor Xuantong), reigned 1908â€“1912.  

These are the twelve emperors from the dynastyâ€™s founder Nurhaci to its last emperor Puyi, who abdicated.
Emperor Qianlong

The Qianlong Emperor (25 September 1711 â€“ 7 February 1799), surnamed Aisin-Gioro and named **Hongli**, was the sixth emperor of the Qing dynasty (fourth if counting from Nurhaciâ€™s founding of Later Jin). His era name **Qianlong** means â€œHeavenly Prosperity.â€ He reigned from **18 October 1735 to 8 February 1796**, wielding supreme power for **63 years and 4 months**, the **longest actual reign** in Chinese history (surpassing Kangxiâ€™s 61 years), and one of the **longest-lived** monarchs (dying at 88).

### ğŸ“Œ Key Life & Achievements
- **Zenith of Power**: Under Qianlong the Qing reached its height, the so-called â€œ**High Qing**â€ or â€œKangâ€“Qian Golden Age.â€ The economy boomed, population topped 300 million, and the empire stretched over 13 million kmÂ².
- **Cultural Legacy**:
  â€“ Commissioned the **Siku Quanshu**, Chinaâ€™s largest encyclopedic anthology (3,500+ works), preserving texts yet also censoring and destroying others.
  â€“ Avid poet himself, composing 40,000+ poems (vast in quantity, uneven in quality).
- **Military & Frontiers**:
  â€“ **Pacified the Dzungars** (1755â€“59), annexing Xinjiang and installing an Ili Governor.
  â€“ **Repelled the Gorkhas** (1791â€“92), stabilizing Tibet and promulgating the **29-Article Ordinance for Tibet**, instituting the Golden Urn lottery for reincarnations.
- **Diplomacy & Trade**:
  â€“ Continued the **single-port trade** (Canton system), rejecting the 1793 Macartney missionâ€™s bid for broader commerce, missing a chance to engage with industrializing Europe.
- **Late Years & Decline**:
  â€“ Trusted the corrupt official Heshen, draining the treasury; the White Lotus rebellion (1796) signaled dynastic downturn.
  â€“ Abdicated in 1796 to his son Yongyan (Jiaqing) but remained **Retired Emperor** in power until death.

### âš–ï¸ Controversies
- **â€œOld Man of Ten Completesâ€**: Branded his ten military campaigns â€œperfect victories,â€ though some (Burma, Vietnam) were pyrrhic.
- **Literary Inquisition**: Peak of Qing thought control; poets like Xu Shukui were executed for alleged sedition.
- **Isolationism**: Maritime prohibitions curtailed foreign trade, leaving China lagging behind global trends.

### ğŸ“ Anecdotes
- **Six southern tours**: Modeled on Kangxiâ€™s, but costly; folklore pairs him with a Han beauty â€œXia Yuhâ€ (pure fiction).
- **Collector mania**: Obsessively stamped and inscribed antiques, nicknamed the **â€œbullet-screen ancestor.â€**

### ğŸ›ï¸ Tomb & Aftermath
- Buried in **Yuling, Eastern Qing Tombs**; looted by warlord Sun Dianying in 1928, bones desecrated, treasures scatteredâ€”a modern cultural catastrophe.

Qianlongâ€™s life mirrored both the last radiance of empire and seeds of its fall, reflecting traditional Chinaâ€™s paradox of grandeur and seclusion.
Qianlong was the fifth son of Yongzheng.

message.content:
Qianlong (Hongli) was actually the **fourth** surviving son of the Yongzheng Emperor, not the fifth.  

Yongzheng had a total of **ten sons**, but only **six** grew to adulthood:

1. Hong-hui (died young, 8 yrs)  
2. Hong-yun (died in infancy)  
3. Hong-shi (posthumously expelled from the clan)  
4. **Hong-li** â€” the future **Qianlong Emperor**  
5. Hong-zhou (Prince He)  
6. Hong-zhan (Prince Guo)  
7. Hong-yao (died young)  
8. Hong-wei (died young)  
9. Hong-peng (died young)  
10. Hong-yuan (died young)

Thus, among the sons who reached adulthood, Hongli (Qianlong) was **fourth in birth order** and the **senior** surviving legitimate son after the early deaths of the first three, making him the natural choice as heir.

messages.content:
Publicly available information is extremely limited; the only conclusion that can be given is â€œ**uncertainâ€”on-site verification required**,â€ for the following reasons:

1. **Too few online reviews**  
   The store has only **2 reviews** on Baidu Maps, with an average score of 3.4/5â€”far too small a sample to gauge real reputation.

2. **No concentrated feedback on third-party platforms**  
   No bulk buyer posts, dispute exposures, or regulatory penalties found on Dianping, Xiaohongshu, TikTok, Black Cat Complaints, etc.â€”neither â€œrave reviewsâ€ nor â€œavoid-at-all-costsâ€ threads.

3. **Business registration merely shows â€œactiveâ€**  
   The company is not listed as abnormal or seriously dishonest, but â€œno red flagsâ€ does not equal â€œtrustworthy.â€

4. **Live-animal transactions are inherently high-risk**  
   Kennels involve â€œlive animal + pay first + post-sale medical liabilityâ€; even well-reviewed ones can have disputes. Extra caution is needed when sample size is tiny.

---

### Recommendations

1. **Background check before visiting**  
   - Ask for **business license, CKU/NGKC pedigree, vaccination book, microchip**, and cross-check against business records.  
   - Request a **real-time video of the current kennel** (feeding, cages, toilet areas) to check for cleanliness, ventilation, and overcrowding.

2. **Put contract and after-sales in writing**  
   - Specify **15â€“30-day warranty for distemper, parvo, etc.**, stating whether illness means refund or free treatment.  
   - State **full refund if the vet exam fails**; donâ€™t pay a large deposit (keep â‰¤ 10% or use third-party escrow) before receiving the contract.

3. **Immediate third-party vet check after purchase**  
   - Within **24 hours** take the dog to a reputable clinic (Ruipeng, Babi Tang, etc.) for CBC, distemper/parvo antigen, fecal test; keep all lab reports.  
   - If problems arise, use **contract + lab reports** to negotiate; if needed, call 12315 or file a small-claims lawsuit.

4. **Use traceable payment methods**  
   - Avoid cash or private WeChat transfers; **prefer corporate account or bank transfer with memo** stating â€œdeposit/balance for Ã—Ã— puppyâ€ to preserve evidence.

---

### Conclusion

With **virtually no verifiable public reputation**, Xing Chong Yuan is in an â€œ**information vacuum**â€; its reliability **cannot be assessed**. If you still consider it, follow the four risk-control steps above and **anchor guarantees in contract and lab reports**; otherwise, switch to a kennel with transparent reviews, standard contracts, and third-party escrow. May you bring home a healthy pup and avoid the pitfalls!

messages.content:
Buying a dog is the first step in a â€œten-year promise.â€ Below, the most critical and easily overlooked points are broken into six sequential steps; follow them in order and youâ€™ll slash the risks. All advice is drawn from 2024â€“2025 sources and the joint guidelines of the Hong Kong Consumer Council and mainland veterinary associations.

---

### â‘  Decide â€œwhether to buyâ€ first  
1. Time: â‰¥ 2 h daily for company, walks, grooming.  
2. Money: 8kâ€“15k RMB per year (vaccines, deworming, food, emergency care).  
3. Space: large breeds need â‰¥ 30 mÂ²; small breeds still require a fixed play zone.  
4. Household: check for allergies, pregnancies, infants in advance.

---

### â‘¡ Pick the right breed, not the cutest  
- Apartment / office workers â†’ Chihuahua, Frenchie, Corgi (low exercise).  
- Yard / sporty types â†’ Border Collie, Labrador, GSD (high energy).  
- Elderly / low-effort â†’ Pug, Poodle (easy care, stable temper).  
- Allergy-prone â†’ Poodle, Bichon (low shedding).

---

### â‘¢ Channel priority (risk from low to high)  
A. Licensed kennel (meet parents, pedigree, clean premises).  
B. Government-registered pet shop (display â€œAnimal Trader Licenceâ€).  
C. Home breeding (friend-referred, mother dog visible).  
D. Rescue group (low fee, basic shots done).  
**Avoid**: street stalls, short-video â€œflash salesâ€, Taobao â€œfree-shipping dogsâ€ â€” >60 % chance of â€œweek-dogâ€ death.

---

### â‘£ On-site â€œ5 looks, 3 smells, 1 testâ€  
**Look**  
1. Spirit: follows people, plays with toy â‰¥30 s without wilting.  
2. Nose: moist & cool, no pus.  
3. Eyes: clear, no yellow-green discharge.  
4. Ears: pink-white, no odor, head-shake <2/min.  
5. Anus: clean, no dried feces.  

**Smell**  
1. Breath: no foul rot (rules out viral enteritis).  
2. Ear odor: no sour stink (rules out ear mites).  
3. Body odor: no sharp urine reek (sign of poor conditions).  

**Test**  
- Do on-site CDV/CPV antigen strip (30â€“50 RMB; seller must cooperate).

---

### â‘¤ Six clauses that must be in the contract  
1. Vaccine batch & dates (attach original health booklet).  
2. Microchip number (matches booklet).  
3. 15-day distemper & parvo guarantee: full refund or free treatment if sick.  
4. 7-day return if third-party exam fails.  
5. Parentsâ€™ pedigree copies (if pure-breed promised).  
6. Dispute resolution: name the court or consumer council.

---

### â‘¥ First 48 h after purchase  
1. Go straight to a proper clinic for â€œnew-puppy panelâ€ (CBC, fecal, antigen, basic chem panel), 200â€“400 RMB; keep hard-copy report.  
2. Video-call seller to open a file and create an after-sales group chat.  
3. No baths, no outdoor walks, no food change for 15 days to reduce stress.

---

Execute all six steps and youâ€™ll minimize the big three traps: â€œweek-dogâ€ death, refund fights, and genetic-disease bombs. May you find a healthy, like-minded pupâ€”and may it give you a happy decade-plus together!

messages.content: Shenling Baizhu Powder is primarily used to strengthen the spleen, boost qi, and eliminate dampness. It is suitable for conditions such as spleen and stomach qi deficiency with dampness accumulation, irritable bowel syndrome with spleen deficiency, and certain cases of gallstones associated with spleen deficiency and blood stasis. However, it is not effective as a standalone treatment for kidney yang deficiency, and should be combined with other herbs when both spleen deficiency and kidney yang deficiency are present. It is not suitable for individuals with yin deficiency, damp-heat, or during fever.

message.content:
Let's compare the two fractions step by step:

We are comparing:

\[
\frac{15}{8} \quad \text{and} \quad \frac{15}{16}
\]

Both numerators are the same (15), so the fraction with the smaller denominator is larger. Since 8 is smaller than 16, we have:

\[
\frac{15}{8} > \frac{15}{16}
\]

**Answer:**  
\[
\frac{15}{8} \text{ is greater than } \frac{15}{16}
\]

messages.content:
You are Kimi, an AI assistant developed by Moonshot AI.  
  
When faced with logic questions like comparisons or counting, think step by step before answering.  

Today is: Friday, September 27, 2025

Chapter 1  
May 22, 2022â€”Shi Jinyuâ€™s fifteenth birthday.  
The gift from the big brothers of her familyâ€™s oldest friends arrived in a black folder: 100 % of Time Fengjun Entertainment, signed over to her name.  

The next afternoon, secretary and PA in tow, she walked through the companyâ€™s front doors to â€œshow her faceâ€ and meet the staff.  
Within minutes, every artist in the buildingâ€”  
First generation: Wang Junkai, Wang Yuan, Yi Yangqianxi.  
Second generation: Ao Ziyi, Yao Jingyuan, Chen Sixu, Li Tianze, plus TNTâ€™s Ma Jiaqi, Ding Chengxin, Song Yaxuan, Liu Yaowen, Zhang Zhenyuan, Yan Haoxiang, He Junlin.  
Third generation: Zhu Zhixin, Zuo Hang, Zhang Zeyu, Zhang Ji, Su Xinhao, Yu Yuhan, Deng Jiaxin, Mu Zhicheng, Zhang Junhao, Huang Shuo, Tong Yukun, Chen Tianrun, Yao Yichen.  

â€”were herded into the top-floor conference room to greet their new boss.  

The door shut.  
Secretary, PA, executives, and staff were all waved out.  
The girl who had looked every inch the cold, untouchable heiress suddenly broke into a run, skirt flying, and flung herself into the arms of the sixteen-year-old trainee standing last in line.  

â€œHang-chan~ Long time no see~â€  

Zuo Hang caught her easily, laughing low.  
â€œYaâ€™er, itâ€™s been ages. First hello and youâ€™re already my boss. Soâ€”what happened?â€  

Shi Jinyu buried her face in his hoodie, voice muffled and small.  
â€œI think I made the wrong wishâ€¦ and now Iâ€™ve broken everything.â€  

He rested his chin on her hair.  
â€œDoesnâ€™t matter. Iâ€™m here. Weâ€™ll fix it together.â€

Chapter One â€“ May 22

The third stroke of her fifteenth birthday bell rang as Shi Jinxi stood on the arched balcony of the Shi familyâ€™s old mansion, watching sunlight settle like gauze over the garden lilies-of-the-valley. She had only wanted a cat, or a front-row concert ticket, but the elders insisted on turning her â€œcoming-of-ageâ€ into a merger.

A black-ebony box was opened by six sets of long, knuckled hands. Inside lay a single thin document: a 100 % equity-transfer agreement for Times Fengjun, her fatherâ€™s bold signature already on the last page, waiting only for her to add the dayâ€™s date.

â€œLittle Jin, from now on every light in this building answers to you,â€ said the eldest Jiang son, voice coaxing yet boardroom-certain.

She hesitated half a second; the nib touched paper, ink burst into a black butterflyâ€”her first disaster, and the exact moment her life forked.

...

The next afternoon, Times Fengjun HQ, A-city financial district.

On the 37th-floor ring-corridor, three generations of artists were told to attend an â€œemergency meeting,â€ notice given just forty minutes earlier. When the lift doors opened, the air mixed fir-scented diffuser with the boysâ€™ own soda-pop smell. First-gen Wang Junkai tugged his cap lower; Ding Chengxin was adjusting Yaoxuanâ€™s in-ear behind his back; third-gen Zhu Zhixin stood on tiptoe peering through glassâ€”everyone guessing whether the new boss was a bald tycoon or some fun-loving rich kid.

Then the conference door swung open.

Shi Jinxi wore a white shirt and gray-plaid pleated skirt; a silver-moon cufflink flashed at each oversized sleeve, making her look thinner. The secretary pulled out the high-back chair; she didnâ€™t sit. Her gaze swept the room, voice soft yet enough to silence dozens of boys at once.

â€œHello, Iâ€™m Shi Jinxi.â€  
She paused two beats, as if checking sheâ€™d pronounced it right. â€œJust here to put faces to names. From now onâ€¦ letâ€™s look after one another.â€

Official script ended there. She tilted her head, murmured â€œeveryone outâ€ to the secretaries; the instant the glass door clicked shut, the chill around her cracked like thin ice.

She spun and flung herself at Zuo Hang standing in the back row.

â€œHang-jaaaangâ€”â€  
The syllable stretched soft and long, like Chongqing summer ice-cream melting. â€œLong time no see.â€

Sixteen-year-old Zuo Hang staggered half a step, the back of his hand brushing the curtain, raising a puff of dust. Instinctively he cradled the back of her head, voice low, helplessly fond: â€œLittle imp, long time no see. First day back and youâ€™re my boss?â€

The whole conference table became a frozen amusement park. Some boys gaped, others pinched each other; even steady Junkai raised an eyebrow. Nobody expected the rumored â€œice-queen shareholderâ€ and a third-gen trainee to be old friendsâ€”nor expected the boy she cuddled up to be Zuo Hang.

Jinxi buried her face in his shoulder, voice muffled like drizzly rain: â€œI think I made the wrong wishâ€¦ and now Iâ€™ve made a mess.â€

Zuo Hang patted her back, smoothing a startled cat. The boys saw his ear tips redden, yet his tone stayed sure: â€œDoesnâ€™t matter. Iâ€™ll face it with you, fix it with you.â€

Outside the floor-to-ceiling windows, sunset ignited the clouds, washing the white wall blood-red like silent fireworks. No one spoke, yet some secret pact seemed to seal the airâ€”

From this second on, Times Fengjun was no longer only their battlefield; it became a fifteen-year-oldâ€™s adventure island. And the boysâ€™ destinies, brushed once by a black butterflyâ€™s wing, now sailed toward an uncharted route.

Continue to the next chapter.

Shi Jinyu: Letâ€™s set the rules first.  
1. From now on, you can skip any cocktail party, gala, or social event you donâ€™t want to attendâ€”just walk out or donâ€™t show up at all. If the investors ask, tell them itâ€™s my call. I may be young, but my backers arenâ€™t small or few; they wonâ€™t dare offend me. If a brand wonâ€™t give you an endorsement, Iâ€™ll summon someone to get you a better one as compensation.  
2. The moment sasaengs or proxy photographers mess with your life, notify Legalâ€”lawyer letters fly, lawsuits filed.  
3. Leak anyoneâ€™s private schedule and youâ€™re fired plus sued for damages.  
4. Stages and concerts: if the plan is solid and legal, Iâ€™ll approve itâ€”anniversary or notâ€”so long as the quality is there.  
5. You pick the city, the theme, the set list; once you decide, my people negotiate and design.  
6. Company team-building trips on the regular, fully expensed; youâ€™re there to relax.  
7. Malicious rumors, smears, or abuseâ€”even onlineâ€”collect the evidence, we sue.  
8. If some senior throws weight around and bullies you, tell us; weâ€™ll pull the company out of the event.  
9. Health and safety first, mental included. Therapists are on 24-hour standby. Feel off? Go talk. Ignore your health and Iâ€™ll freeze your schedule until youâ€™re better. Pull an all-nighter, we confiscate every last snack.

In the era when even the ancestors fear the seniors, Zuo Hangâ€”ignoring that his elders are right thereâ€”adds a tenth rule.

Zuo Hang: Then add this: every time you stay up or do anything bad for your health, dock one of my stages.

Shi Jinyu: ?? No way!! Are you insane? Whatâ€™s it got to do with you? Iâ€™m the boss here, Hang-jian, youâ€™re reversing heaven and earth!

Zuo Hang: Little one, apart from thisâ€”apart from your healthâ€”Iâ€™ll let you have your way on everything. Objection overruled. One all-nighter or one unhealthy move, I lose a stage. Non-negotiable.

Shi Jinyu: Hang-jian, canâ€™t we talk it over? Letâ€™s scrap this one.

Zuo Hang: No deal. Keep bargaining and Iâ€™ll email Planning right now to cancel every stage I have next month.

Shi Jinyu: Fine!!! Enforced it is.

She puffs up like a blowfish, helpless; the boys bite back laughter.

After sulking, she resigns herself and keeps arranging.

Shi Jinyu: Your schedules next week are cleared. Company retreat: Xishuangbanna, Lijiang, and Daliâ€”seven days, six nights.

Chapter Two â€“ Ten Rules and Seven Days, Six Nights

The conference room was so quiet you could hear the central airâ€™s soft hiss.

Each time Shi Jinyu raised a finger, the boysâ€™ eyes lit up a notch. By the eighth rule, spines were already ramrod-straight, ready to bark, â€œYes, boss, mission guaranteed!â€  
Then the ninth rule droppedâ€”and the tone flipped.

â€œâ€¦a psychologist on 24-hour call. Anyone who pulls an all-nighter loses every last snack. Confiscated.â€

Three seconds of silence, then a collective groan:

â€œNoooâ€”my spicy sticks!â€  
â€œEven midnight snacks, boss?!â€  
â€œI request a safe in your office for my stashâ€”password known only to me!â€

Hands on hips, Jinyu wore a â€œI-am-the-emperorâ€ smirk. Just as she opened her mouth to ban bubble tea too, Zuo Hang raised a hand. His voice wasnâ€™t loud, but it sliced through the noiseâ€”

â€œRule ten.â€  
He stepped forward, palm flat on the table, gaze crossing half the room to land on her. â€œIf you stay up once, or do anything bad for your health, I lose one stage.â€

It was like someone hit pause.

Heads swiveled, eyes ping-ponging between them:  
â€”WTF, Zuo Hangâ€™s lost it?  
â€”Heâ€™s threatening the boss?  
â€”And the little boss canâ€™t do squat?!

Jinyu froze for half a second, cheeks puffing into a puffer-fish face. â€œ??? No way!!!â€  
Slapâ€”she smacked the table. â€œAre you insane? Whatâ€™s it to you? Iâ€™M the boss! Hang-juan, youâ€™re reversing the natural order!â€

Zuo Hang lowered his eyes, voice calm: â€œYa-er, I let you have everything except your healthâ€”soâ€”â€  
He gently wrapped her small fist, still pressed to the table, inside his hand. â€œObjection overruled. Keep bargaining and I email the planners to cancel every stage next month.â€

â€œYou wouldnâ€™t!â€  
â€œI would.â€  
â€œâ€¦â€

Like a punctured balloon, she deflated, muttering, â€œFine, weâ€™ll do itâ€¦â€

The onlookers exploded:  
Ding Chengxin buried his face in Song Yaxuanâ€™s shoulder, shaking;  
Liu Yaowen gave Zuo Hang a thumbs-up: â€œBro Hang, role model!â€  
Zhu Zhixin secretly typed into the â€œThird-Gen Undergroundâ€ group:  
ã€Zuo Hang publicly threatens bossâ€”and wins!!!ã€‘

Ears red, Jinyu coughed and yanked the meeting back on track. â€œEnough! Businessâ€”â€  
She tapped her tablet; the schedule flashed on the screen. â€œNext week, everyoneâ€™s cleared. Company retreat: Xishuangbanna, Lijiang, Daliâ€”seven days, six nights.â€

â€œAll expenses covered. Flight tomorrow 10 a.m., private jetâ€”donâ€™t be late.â€  
â€œThemeâ€”â€  
She bared tiny canines: â€œRelax, rest, andâ€¦ Snack-Confiscation Supervision kicks off!â€

Groans rattled the ceiling.

Amid the chaos, Zuo Hang secretly hooked her pinky with his and whispered, â€œYa-er, Iâ€™ll watch you sleep. No midnight bubble-tea heists.â€

She shot him a fierce wink: â€œYou watch, I dock your stage.â€  
â€œFine,â€ he smiled. â€œDock one and Iâ€™ll sing â€˜Happy Birthdayâ€™ for you in publicâ€”off-key.â€  
â€œâ€¦dirty move!â€

Outside, early-summer sun coated the glass, gilding everyone inside.  
None of them knew what unexpected chapters this â€œrelaxingâ€ seven-day, six-night voyage would writeâ€”  
but right then the boys just cheered, a band of adventurers clutching fresh tickets, ready to sail.

message.content:
Chapter Three â€“ The Flight, the Bet, and the Thunderstorm

1  
The company jet was taxiing by 10:02 a.m.  
Inside, the cabin looked like a cross between a karaoke box and a kindergarten: neon strip-lights under the luggage rails, three rows of butter-yellow recliners that swivelled 180Â°, and a long counter already loaded with fruit platters the size of satellite dishes.  
Shi Jinyu had boarded first; she sat cross-legged on a couch at the rear, tablet on her knee, issuing last-minute edits to the ground-staff roster. Every time she glanced up, another boy popped through the hatch, offering a shy â€œMorning, boss,â€ before diving for a seat.

2  
Zuo Hang arrived last, hoodie half-zipped, earbuds dangling like a stethoscope. He paused in the aisle, counted heads, then dropped into the empty seat beside Jinyu without asking.  
â€œSeat 1A is labelled â€˜Presidentâ€™, you know,â€ she muttered.  
â€œExactly,â€ he said, clicking his belt. â€œIâ€™m your body-guard, remember? Proximity clause.â€  
She rolled her eyes but didnâ€™t move.

3  
At cruising altitude the seat-belt sign blinked off and pandemonium bloomed.  
Wang Junkai and Yi Yangqianxi claimed the starboard row, instantly challenged by second-gen to a card game whose rules seemed to involve shouting â€œBomb!â€ every thirty seconds. Third-gen clustered around the snack islandâ€”until Jinyu cleared her throat.  
â€œRecall Rule Nine,â€ she reminded. â€œHealthy snacks only before lunch.â€  
Zhang Zhenyuan, hand already in a bag of spicy gluten sticks, froze like a museum statue. Laughter erupted; phones snapped photos.  
Jinyu allowed herself a grin. â€œRelax. Confiscation starts after we land. Consider this the last supper.â€  
A collective â€œBoss is merciful!â€ echoed down the cabin.

4  
Half-way through the flight the captainâ€™s voice crackled:  
â€œLadies and gentlemen, weâ€™re diverting around a thunderstorm cell over Guizhou. Expect moderate chop.â€  
Seconds later the plane lurched. Plates slid; someone yelped.  
Jinyuâ€™s tablet bucked off her knee. Zuo Hang caught it left-handed, right arm already across her shoulders.  
â€œIâ€™m fine,â€ she hissed, cheeks colouring.  
â€œHumour me,â€ he replied, not removing the arm.  
Lightning flashed outside the porthole, bleaching every face. For a moment even the first-gen looked their age.  
Ding Chengxin whispered, â€œWeâ€™re gonna die before the retreat even startsâ€¦â€  
From somewhere up front came Song Yaxuanâ€™s shaky tenor: â€œIf we do, at least weâ€™ll be a legendâ€”â€˜TNT perishes in snack-laden jetâ€™.â€  
The joke broke the tension; a dozen boys laughed too loud.  
Inside her ribcage Jinyu felt her own panic recede, anchored by the steady pressure of Zuo Hangâ€™s arm. She let it stay.

5  
When the turbulence eased, Ma Jiaqi produced a wireless mic and proposed a â€œcalm-the-nervesâ€ talent segment.  
Rules: one minute max, no props, loser buys everyone fresh coconuts on arrival.  
First up: Zhu Zhixin attempted a back-flip in the aisle, misjudged ceiling height, and crash-landed on Liu Yaowenâ€™s lapâ€”automatic forfeit.  
Second: Zhang Ji delivered a dead-serious Shakespearean monologue in Chongqing dialect; applause, but no standing ovation.  
Then Zuo Hang stood.  
â€œIâ€™ll sing,â€ he said.  
Jinyuâ€™s head snapped up. He never volunteered solos.  
He chose an old folk lullaby, soft and low, almost a capella. Half-way through he shifted the final chorus into a minor key, eyes fixed on Jinyu the entire time.  
The cabin went pin-drop silent.  
When he finished, nobody clapped at firstâ€”then thunderous cheers. Even the first-gen gave wolf-whistles.  
Ma Jiaqi raised an eyebrow at Jinyu: â€œBoss, score?â€  
She folded her arms, fighting a smile. â€œTechnically perfect, emotionallyâ€¦ dangerous. Ten points.â€  
â€œMeaning he wins?â€  
â€œMeaning he owes everyone double coconuts anywayâ€”because I say so.â€  
Laughter. Zuo Hang bowed, sat, and murmured to her, â€œWorth it.â€

6  
They began descent into Xishuangbanna at 1:15 p.m. Sunlight spilled through broken clouds, glazing the Mekongâ€™s brown coils far below.  
Jinyu rose, clutching the seat-back for balance.  
â€œListen up,â€ she called. â€œSeven days, six nights. No managers, no press, no fans. Phones allowed only for photosâ€”post after we leave. First stop: rainforest eco-lodge outside Jinghong. Activities tomorrow include tree-canopy walk and team cook-off. Tonightâ€”bonfire andâ€¦ confiscation ceremony.â€  
Groans again, but softer now, almost affectionate.  
She added, almost to herself: â€œAnd Rule Ten is in force. Anyone caught sneaking energy drinks after midnight answers to Zuo Hangâ€”and to me.â€  
Zuo Hang lifted her discarded tablet, tapped the screen twice, and held it up: he had already changed her lock-wallpaper to a photo of the two of them at thirteen, cheeks painted like tigers at a temple fair.  
She saw it, said nothing, but her ears turned scarlet.

7  
The wheels touched tarmac with a gentle squeal. Outside, tropical heat shimmered like liquid glass.  
As they filed toward the exit, Yi Yangqianxi leaned to Wang Junkai: â€œThink the storm was an omen?â€  
Junkai shrugged. â€œEvery summer has lightning. Question is who ends up groundedâ€”and who walks away charged.â€  
Behind them, Jinyu paused at the hatch, feeling the wall of humid air hit her face.  
She thought: I signed a company, inherited a storm, and maybeâ€”maybeâ€”bought myself seven days of borrowed time.  
A hand brushed hers: Zuo Hang, passing forward to descend the stairs.  
â€œReady, boss?â€ he asked quietly.  
She exhaled. â€œReady, body-guard.â€  
They stepped into the sunlight together, the rest of the boys streaming after, laughter ricocheting off the fuselage.  
High above, the thundercloud theyâ€™d dodged still rumbled, trailing them like a warningâ€”or a promiseâ€”that nothing on this retreat would stay simple for long.

messages.name: resource

messages.content: Answer the questions inside.
The reason for the decrease in oxygen concentration when a candle is lit.

When a candle burns, the oxygen concentration drops because the candle reacts chemically with the oxygen, producing carbon dioxide and water. Specifically, the main component of a candle is paraffin, which, once ignited, undergoes an oxidation reaction with the oxygen in the air. The reaction can be represented as:

\[ \text{paraffin} + \text{oxygen} \rightarrow \text{carbon dioxide} + \text{water} \]

During this process, oxygen is consumed, generating carbon dioxide and water vapor. As oxygen is used up, its concentration gradually decreases while the concentration of carbon dioxide increases. This is why the oxygen level falls as the candle burns. As the oxygen concentration declines, the candleâ€™s combustion weakens until insufficient oxygen causes the flame to go out.
The reason why oxygen concentration remains unchanged after a candle is extinguished

Possible reasons why the oxygen concentration remains unchanged after the candle goes out in the experiment include:

1. **Air circulation**: Air may be circulating in the experimental space, promptly replacing the oxygen consumed and keeping the overall concentration steady.

2. **Limited oxygen consumption**: The amount of oxygen the candle burns is tiny relative to the total oxygen present, so any change is too small to detect.

3. **Short experimental duration**: If the candle burns only briefly, the total oxygen consumed is minimal and the concentration shift falls within the margin of observability.

4. **Measurement error**: The oxygen sensor or data logger may have inherent inaccuracies that prevent small changes from being recorded.

5. **External oxygen inflow**: The setup may not be perfectly sealed, allowing outside oxygen to enter and offset what the flame uses.

6. **Dynamic equilibrium**: A balance can form between oxygen consumption and replenishment, stabilizing the concentration for a period.

These factors can explain why no obvious change in oxygen level is observed after the candle extinguishes. Note that these are general hypotheses; the actual cause must be assessed in light of the specific experimental design and conditions.

The above system of equations already constitutes a mathematically complete and closed control framework; once boundary conditions strictly consistent with physical reality are introduced, the flow-field problem can be transformed into a well-posed closed problem in the sense of Hadamard, thereby laying a solid theoretical foundation for subsequent analytical or numerical solution.

The listed equations already constitute a mathematically closed system describing the fluid motion field; with appropriate boundary conditions for the specific situation, the initial-boundary-value problem can be turned into a well-posed solution framework.
Academic language

The system of equations already satisfies the completeness requirement at the mathematical-structural level, forming a closed set of flow-governing equations; on this basis, once physically appropriate boundary constraints are imposed, the initialâ€“boundary-value problem becomes well-posed in the sense of Hadamard, providing a solid theoretical framework for subsequent analytical or numerical solution.

One more, this is about the NS equationsâ€”will there be a numerical solution?

Thus, once this closed-form Navierâ€“Stokes system is endowed with physically realistic boundary constraints, it is immediately elevated to a well-posed problem in the sense of Hadamard, establishing the existence, uniqueness, and continuous dependence of its solution and thereby furnishing a rigorous and computable mathematical framework for subsequent numerical discretization strategies such as finite-volume, finite-element, or spectral methods.

(2) RNG k-Îµ model [77]  
RNG stands for â€œRenormalization Group.â€ For the k and Îµ equations, the RNG k-Îµ model is very similar to the Standard k-Îµ model.  

k-equation  
âˆ‚(Ïk)/âˆ‚t + âˆ‚(Ïk u_i)/âˆ‚x_i = âˆ‚/âˆ‚x_i [(Î¼+Î¼_t)/Ïƒ_k âˆ‚k/âˆ‚x_i] + G_k + Ï Îµ  (2-26)  

Îµ-equation  
âˆ‚(ÏÎµ)/âˆ‚t + âˆ‚(ÏÎµ u_i)/âˆ‚x_i = âˆ‚/âˆ‚x_i [(Î¼+Î¼_t)/Ïƒ_Îµ âˆ‚Îµ/âˆ‚x_i] + Ï C_{2Îµ} ÎµÂ²/k  (2-27)  

where  
Î¼_t = C_Î¼ Ï kÂ²/Îµ,â€ƒC_Î¼ = 0.0845,â€ƒÏƒ_k = Ïƒ_Îµ = 1.39  

Compared with the Standard k-Îµ model, the RNG k-Îµ model corrects the turbulent viscosity, accounts for swirl in the flow, and introduces the effect of spatial position, making it more suitable for flows with high strain rates and strongly curved streamlines.  

(3) Realizable k-Îµ model  
Because the Standard k-Îµ model can give noticeable errorsâ€”and even produce negative normal stressesâ€”when the mean strain rate is large, some researchers [75] argued that C_Î¼ in the turbulent-viscosity formula should not be constant but should depend on the strain rate. Based on this, the Realizable k-Îµ model was proposed.  

k-equation  
âˆ‚(Ïk)/âˆ‚t + âˆ‚(Ïk u_i)/âˆ‚x_i = âˆ‚/âˆ‚x_i [(Î¼+Î¼_t)/Ïƒ_k âˆ‚k/âˆ‚x_i] + G_k + G_b âˆ’ Ï Îµ âˆ’ Y_M  (2-28)  

Îµ-equation  
âˆ‚(ÏÎµ)/âˆ‚t + âˆ‚(ÏÎµ u_i)/âˆ‚x_i = âˆ‚/âˆ‚x_i [(Î¼+Î¼_t)/Ïƒ_Îµ âˆ‚Îµ/âˆ‚x_i] + Ï C_1 S Îµ âˆ’ Ï C_2 ÎµÂ²/(k+âˆš(Î½ Îµ))  (2-29)  

where  
C_1 = max[0.43, Î·/(Î·+5)],â€ƒÎ· = S k/Îµ,â€ƒS = âˆš(2 S_{ij} S_{ij})  

G_k is the production of turbulent kinetic energy due to mean velocity gradients, G_b is the production due to buoyancy, Y_M represents the contribution of fluctuating dilatation in compressible turbulence, and the model constants are Ïƒ_k = 1.0, Ïƒ_Îµ = 1.2, C_2 = 1.9.

message.content:
The Zhoushan membrane material production base under construction by Linyi Yunchuan is a key node in the industrialization of floating wind power, and its impact is reflected in four aspects:

1. Cost reduction  
The film accounts for 25-30% of the cost of the entire airframe. After localization, the unit cost is expected to drop by 18-22%, directly pulling down the kilowatt-hour cost of floating wind power from the current 0.35 yuan to about 0.28 yuan, approaching the parity of onshore wind power.

2. Delivery guarantee  
In the past, high-strength composite films relied on imports, and the delivery cycle was 4-6 months. After the base is completed, the delivery cycle will be shortened to 30 days, and the annual production capacity will be able to meet 2GW supporting facilities, eliminating the "jam neck" risk brought about by a single supply chain.

3. Technical iteration acceleration  
The base has built an in-house film material R&D center, which can quickly convert the S1500 system with a height of 10,000 meters into a pilot test within 4 weeks, shortening the iteration cycle of the past outsourcing model by half.

4. Industrial agglomeration effect  
Zhoushan has gathered 7 upstream and downstream enterprises such as cable, harness, and floating body, forming a localized industrial cluster with a radius of 50 kilometers, reducing logistics and quality control costs by 12%, and providing a complete industrialization support platform for the large-scale replication of floating wind power in the future.

In short, the membrane material base turns the core barrier of floating wind power from "import dependence" into "independent controllable", giving the track the conditions for large-scale commercial operation.

Today is: Friday, September 27, 2025

New-energy leader BYD has joined forces with national goddess Gao Yuanyuan to launch the 2026 Denza N9. Armed with eÂ³, Yunjian-A, Sky Eye B, and a plug-in 2.0T dedicated high-efficiency engine, the tech-laden luxury SUV drew instant attention, sealing BYDâ€™s profits for the year. Measuring 5258/2030/1830 mm on a 3125 mm wheelbase, the full-size flagship debuts four two-tone paintsâ€”Zirong Gold, Hongya Gold, Lanchen Silver, LÃ¼hua Silverâ€”and the single-tone Frost Cloud Tea. Sharper lines, flush door handles, and a floating roof make the N9 appear longer, wider, and more refined. Inside, four screens, zero-gravity captain chairs, and a 2400 W Hi-Fi turn every journey into a private lounge.

The moment the 2026 Denza N9 arrives, it writes â€œluxuryâ€ into the very air. At 5258 Ã— 2030 Ã— 1830 mm and with a 3125 mm wheelbase, its commanding presence brings its own red-carpet aura. Four new two-tone finishesâ€”Purple-Gold, Red-Gold, Blue-Silver, Green-Silverâ€”shift light like haute couture inspired by Chinese heritage; the single-tone â€œFrost-Cloud Teaâ€ is as understated as Gao Yuanyuanâ€™s glanceâ€”soft yet lethal.  
Tri-motor e-4WD plus Yunjian-A active hydraulic suspension: corners feel like silk, bumps feel like air. The â€œEye of Heavenâ€ Level-2+ ADAS turns long drives into nap time. A dedicated 2.0T range-extender hits 45 % thermal efficiency; even when the battery is â€œemptyâ€ it sips just 5.8 L/100 kmâ€”this full-size SUV can run a week without refueling.  
Inside: Nappa + suede, executive rear leg rests, hot/cold fridge, ceiling screenâ€”an executive suite on wheels. National goddess Gao Yuanyuan personally endorses it, fusing elegance and tech to the max. Launch-day sell-out: BYDâ€™s 2026 profit is locked, and Chinaâ€™s luxury new-energy brand steps squarely onto the worldâ€™s center stage.

The 2026 Denza N9 upgrades its intelligent cockpit. A new main-screen UI automatically splits when Drive is engaged, lets apps be dragged across displays, and adopts a frosted-glass look; the bottom nav bar can be customized. One-tap â€œPrivacy Shieldâ€ instantly muffles cabin mics, while an anti-motion-sickness algorithm smooths acceleration curves. â€œCelestial Eye Bâ€ fuses one LiDAR, five mmWave radars and twelve cameras into a 254-TOPS Nvidia-driven perception net, covering city NOA, valet parking and emergency braking. Wireless linksâ€”CarLink, HiCar, Honor CarConnectâ€”pair with 700-plus phones, tablets and watches across Android, HarmonyOS and iOS. Four-microphone arrays and headrest speakers enable point-to-point whisper mode; second-row screens can mirror mobile games with 40 ms latency. Air-suspension pre-loads road data from the ADAS map to erase bumps before occupants feel them. From zero-latency voice print unlock to panoramic 3D desktop, every interaction is faster, quieter, safer.

message.content:
To make the â€œstriverâ€ element more prominent without introducing literal human figures, we can:

1. Replace the generic spiral with a sharper, upward-thrusting angular form that evokes ascent and momentum.  
2. Intensify the color contrast: give the striver-shape a hotter, more saturated palette (fiery orange â†’ solar yellow) while keeping the consumer orbs cool and calm.  
3. Add directional light: let a strong diagonal beam originate from the lower-left and strike the striver-form, creating long, forward-leaning highlights that read as â€œdrive.â€  
4. Introduce subtle textureâ€”fine, converging lines or etched striationsâ€”within the striver-form so the eye lingers there first.  
5. Keep the consumer orbs visually secondary: smaller, softer, and receding into the mid-tone background.

Simply red two mouths  
Alright, no more digressions.  

Maybe folks who donâ€™t usually read web-novels donâ€™t realize that social-media ads are now packed with jaw-droppingly absurd stories. Take the types I just mentioned as examples.  

First up is the much-hyped â€œNational Destiny Arenaâ€ genre. At first glance it doesnâ€™t seem that idiotic: basically itâ€™s a â€œGuan Yu fights Qin Qiongâ€ setup where ancient heroes from every civilization are summoned to duke it out, rather like the recently popular â€œRecord of Ragnarok.â€  

But here comes the heavy part: in the â€œNational Destiny Arenaâ€ universe, the histories of Hua and Dragon countries are broken. Only the protagonist knows the real badasses of the past. Itâ€™s awkwardâ€”side characters watch unknown generals slaughter everything while enjoying illogical â€œnational-destiny buffs,â€ and it looks ridiculous.  

Worst of all, the authorâ€™s knowledge isnâ€™t enough to writeç™½èµ· vs. Alexander or Sun Wukong thrashing Zeus. After peddling cheap, formulaic cultural pride, these novels usually end with the author disappearing mid-story.

api.add_resource(DatasetRetrievalSettingApi, "/datasets/retrieval-setting")
api.add_resource(DatasetRetrievalSettingMockApi, "/datasets/retrieval-setting/<string:vector_type>")

class DatasetRetrievalSettingApi(Resource):
    @setup_required
    @login_required
    @account_initialization_required
    def get(self):
        vector_type = dify_config.VECTOR_STORE
        match vector_type:
            case (
                VectorType.RELYT
                | VectorType.PGVECTOR
                | VectorType.TIDB_VECTOR
                | VectorType.CHROMA
                | VectorType.TENCENT
                | VectorType.PGVECTO_RS
                | VectorType.BAIDU
                | VectorType.VIKINGDB
                | VectorType.UPSTASH
                | VectorType.OCEANBASE
            ):
                return {"retrieval_method": [RetrievalMethod.SEMANTIC_SEARCH.value]}
            case (
                VectorType.QDRANT
                | VectorType.WEAVIATE
                | VectorType.OPENSEARCH
                | VectorType.ANALYTICDB
                | VectorType.MYSCALE
                | VectorType.ORACLE
                | VectorType.ELASTICSEARCH
                | VectorType.ELASTICSEARCH_JA
                | VectorType.PGVECTOR
                | VectorType.TIDB_ON_QDRANT
                | VectorType.LINDORM
                | VectorType.COUCHBASE
                | VectorType.MILVUS
            ):
                return {
                    "retrieval_method": [
                        RetrievalMethod.SEMANTIC_SEARCH.value,
                        RetrievalMethod.FULL_TEXT_SEARCH.value,
                        RetrievalMethod.HYBRID_SEARCH.value,
                    ]
                }
            case _:
                raise ValueError(f"Unsupported vector db type {vector_type}.")


class DatasetRetrievalSettingMockApi(Resource):
    @setup_required
    @login_required
    @account_initialization_required
    def get(self, vector_type):
        match vector_type:
            case (
                VectorType.MILVUS
                | VectorType.RELYT
                | VectorType.TIDB_VECTOR
                | VectorType.CHROMA
                | VectorType.TENCENT
                | VectorType.PGVECTO_RS
                | VectorType.BAIDU
                | VectorType.VIKINGDB
                | VectorType.UPSTASH
                | VectorType.OCEANBASE
            ):
                return {"retrieval_method": [RetrievalMethod.SEMANTIC_SEARCH.value]}
            case (
                VectorType.QDRANT
                | VectorType.WEAVIATE
                | VectorType.OPENSEARCH
                | VectorType.ANALYTICDB
                | VectorType.MYSCALE
                | VectorType.ORACLE
                | VectorType.ELASTICSEARCH
                | VectorType.ELASTICSEARCH_JA
                | VectorType.COUCHBASE
                | VectorType.PGVECTOR
                | VectorType.LINDORM
            ):
                return {
                    "retrieval_method": [
                        RetrievalMethod.SEMANTIC_SEARCH.value,
                        RetrievalMethod.FULL_TEXT_SEARCH.value,
                        RetrievalMethod.HYBRID_SEARCH.value,
                    ]
                }
            case _:
                raise ValueError(f"Unsupported vector db type {vector_type}.")

è§£é‡Šè¿™ä¸¤ä¸ªapiçš„ä½œç”¨

These two APIs are used to **return the retrieval methods supported by the vector database**, based on its type, so that the frontend can display or configure dataset options.

---

### 1. `DatasetRetrievalSettingApi`
- **Path**: `/datasets/retrieval-setting`  
- **Purpose**: Returns the retrieval methods supported by the vector database **actually configured in the current deployment** (obtained via `dify_config.VECTOR_STORE`).  
- **Usage**: When users view or configure a dataset in the frontend, the system dynamically shows the available retrieval methods (e.g., semantic search, full-text search, hybrid search) according to the deployed vector database.  
- **Examples**:
  - If `MILVUS` is deployed:
    ```json
    {"retrieval_method": ["semantic_search", "full_text_search", "hybrid_search"]}
    ```
  - If `RELYT` is deployed:
    ```json
    {"retrieval_method": ["semantic_search"]}
    ```

---

### 2. `DatasetRetrievalSettingMockApi`
- **Path**: `/datasets/retrieval-setting/<string:vector_type>` (`vector_type` is a path parameter)  
- **Purpose**: **For simulation/testing**, allows the frontend or testers to **pass any vector-database type** and receive the retrieval methods it supports, **independent of the actual deployment**.  
- **Usage**:
  - Frontend development to simulate different vector databases.
  - Testing compatibility of retrieval methods across databases.  
- **Examples**:
  - `GET /datasets/retrieval-setting/MILVUS` returns:
    ```json
    {"retrieval_method": ["semantic_search"]}
    ```
  - `GET /datasets/retrieval-setting/QDRANT` returns:
    ```json
    {"retrieval_method": ["semantic_search", "full_text_search", "hybrid_search"]}
    ```

---

### Key Differences
| Feature                  | `DatasetRetrievalSettingApi`               | `DatasetRetrievalSettingMockApi`              |
|--------------------------|--------------------------------------------|-----------------------------------------------|
| **Data Source**          | Actual deployed `dify_config.VECTOR_STORE` | User-supplied `vector_type` parameter        |
| **Purpose**              | Production dynamic configuration           | Simulate different databases in dev/test      |
| **Path Parameter**       | None                                       | Requires `vector_type` path parameter        |
| **Deployment Constrained**| Yes                                        | No                                            |

---

### Notes
1. **Duplicate enum values**:  
   `PGVECTOR` and `TIDB_VECTOR` appear in both APIs, possibly redundant; confirm actual support.
2. **MILVUS discrepancy**:  
   - In `DatasetRetrievalSettingApi`, `MILVUS` supports three methods (`SEMANTIC_SEARCH`, `FULL_TEXT_SEARCH`, `HYBRID_SEARCH`).  
   - In `DatasetRetrievalSettingMockApi`, `MILVUS` only supports `SEMANTIC_SEARCH`.  
   **Likely an omission in the mock enum; align the two.**
Why is PGVECTOR enumerated twice in DatasetRetrievalSettingApi?

This is a **code typo** (bug).  
In the `match` statement of `DatasetRetrievalSettingApi`, `PGVECTOR` appears in two arms:

1. The arm that only supports `SEMANTIC_SEARCH` (together with RELYT, TIDB_VECTOR, etc.).  
2. The arm that supports all three retrieval modes (together with QDRANT, WEAVIATE, etc.).

Pythonâ€™s `match-case` executes only the **first** arm that matches a value, so the second occurrence of `PGVECTOR` is never reached. In effect, `PGVECTOR` is treated as supporting only `SEMANTIC_SEARCH`.

Fix:  
- If `PGVECTOR` actually supports all three modes, remove it from the first arm;  
- Otherwise, remove it from the second arm.

Convert \u00A0 spaces in the string to normal spaces.

The simplest one-liner:

```python
text = text.replace('\u00A0', ' ')
```

If the input might contain HTML entities (` ` or ` `), just add two more lines:

```python
text = (text
        .replace(' ', ' ')
        .replace(' ', ' ')
        .replace('\u00A0', ' '))
```

This ensures that all non-breaking spaces, regardless of their source, are converted to regular spaces.

View specific data in the table

After connecting to the `dify_v` database in `psql`, there are two common ways to inspect the actual data of a table:

---

### âœ… Method 1: Basic query (recommended)
```sql
-- View first 10 rows (avoids flooding the screen)
SELECT * FROM <table_name> LIMIT 10;
```

Example:
```sql
SELECT * FROM datasets LIMIT 10;
```

---

### âœ… Method 2: Paged viewing (interactive)
```sql
-- Turn paging on (usually on by default)
\pset pager on

-- Run the query
SELECT * FROM <table_name>;
```
Press `Space` to page down, `q` to quit.

---

### âœ… Method 3: View column names only (structure)
```sql
\d <table_name>
```

Example:
```sql
\d datasets
```

---

### âœ… Method 4: View selected columns only
```sql
SELECT id, name FROM datasets LIMIT 5;
```

---

### Exit psql
```sql
\q
```

---

### Quick tip
If the table is large, add a `WHERE` clause or `ORDER BY`:
```sql
SELECT * FROM documents WHERE status = 'completed' ORDER BY created_at DESC LIMIT 10;
```

text = re.sub(r'^\s*\n', '', text, flags=re.MULTILINE)
è§£é‡Šä»£ç

This line of code **removes every blank line** from the textâ€”i.e., deletes any line that contains only zero or more whitespace characters (spaces, tabs, form-feeds, etc.) followed by a newline `\n`.

Step-by-step:

- `re.sub(pattern, repl, text, flags=...)`  
  Regular-expression substitution: find substrings in `text` that match `pattern` and replace them with `repl`.

- `r'^\s*\n'`  
  Pattern:  
  - `^` start of line (because `re.MULTILINE` is used, it means â€œstart of each lineâ€).  
  - `\s*` zero or more whitespace characters (space, `\t`, `\r`, etc.).  
  - `\n` a newline immediately following.  
  Together this matches a â€œblank lineâ€.

- `''`  
  Replace with the empty string, i.e., delete the matched blank line.

- `flags=re.MULTILINE`  
  Makes `^` and `$` match the start/end of each line instead of the whole string.

After running:

```
abc

def


ghi
```

becomes

```
abc
def
ghi
```

)

messages.content:
[Search keywords]: Nanjing Agricultural University, cherish food, refuse waste, cultural festival, audience

[No.]: [^1^]  
Title: Our University Holds â€œCherish Food, Refuse Wasteâ€ Themed Cultural Festival â€“ College of Science, NAU  
Site: College of Science, NAU  
Date: 2023-04-11  
Excerpt 1:  
To thoroughly implement General Secretary Xi Jinpingâ€™s important instructions on curbing food waste, promote publicity of the Anti-Food Waste Law, help young teachers and students firmly establish a â€œbig foodâ€ outlook, and internalize and practice the fine tradition of thrift, on the morning of April 11 the â€œAnti-Food Waste on Campusâ€ campaign was held at Nanjing Agricultural University. Attending were Luo Xueming, deputy director of Jiangsu Food Safety Office and food-safety director of the provincial Market Regulation Bureau; Liu Yingjun, deputy Party secretary of NAU; Shao Xiaoqing and Xue Weiyu, heads of food inspection and food-business sections; as well as leaders from the university Youth League Committee, College of Science, and Logistics Support Department.

With the theme â€œCherish Food, Refuse Waste,â€ the event used physical displays and interactive games to publicize anti-waste, guiding young people to uphold socialist core values and become practitioners against food waste, role models of thrift, and advocates of civilized health.

Every grain comes hardâ€”after long growth, seasonal trials, and final fruition it devotes its â€œlifeâ€ to humanity. The exhibition offered two routes: one, colleges used their specialties to sketch â€œA Grain of Riceâ€™s Story,â€ with students detailing rice nursery, transplanting, irrigation, fertilization, pest control and harvest, letting participants see how rice reaches the bowl; the other focused on â€œgreen, healthy, thrifty,â€ showing studentsâ€™ vigorous civilized life and making â€œoppose waste, revere thriftâ€ a daily habit.

â€œThink how hard each porridge and rice comes,â€ â€œWho knows every grain in the bowl is hard-earnedâ€â€¦ Students said they now clearer understand national food-security strategy; saving food is both a Chinese virtue and a legal duty. They pledged to start with themselves, put â€œCherish Food, Refuse Wasteâ€ into practice, and be advocates of civilized living. During the event, the provincial market-regulation delegation toured NAUâ€™s State Key Lab of Meat Quality Control and Resource Creation, heard logistics briefings on food-safety education, and held a â€œYou Point, We Test on Campusâ€ publicity activity.

message.content:
Got itâ€”looking for **DGL in the food context**.

In nutrition and health, **DGL** usually stands for **Deglycyrrhizinated Licorice** (often sold as â€œDGL licoriceâ€).  

Key points:

- **What it is**: Licorice root from which most of the compound glycyrrhizin has been removed.  
- **Why remove glycyrrhizin**: Glycyrrhizin can raise blood pressure and lower potassium; taking it out keeps the soothing mucosal benefits while greatly reducing those side-effects.  
- **Common food / supplement forms**: Chewable tablets, capsules, powders, teas, and even some functional candies marketed for digestive comfort.  
- **Typical use**: Chewed 5-20 minutes before meals to support gastric or duodenal comfort (e.g., occasional heartburn, acid reflux, or canker-sores).  
- **Flavor profile**: Still distinctly sweet-herbal, but milder than regular licorice candy.  

If you were asking about something else food-related, just let me know!
